snippet: Surveillance by the New York City police has harmed the fight against terrorism, said Michael B. Ward, the special agent in charge of the F.B.I.’s Newark office, on Wednesday.
abstract: Federal Bureau of Investigation says that the New York City Police Department's surveillance of Muslims in New Jersey is harming the federal fight against terrorism by fomenting distrust among the state's Muslims.
lead_paragraph: Surveillance by the New York City police has harmed the fight against terrorism, said Michael B. Ward, the special agent in charge of the F.B.I.’s Newark office, on Wednesday.

headline.seo: Chief of F.B.I. Newark Bureau Decries Police Monitoring of Muslims
headline.main: F.B.I. Official Faults Police Tactics on Muslims
headline.print_headline: F.B.I. Official Faults Tactics By the Police On Muslims
